009package imagingbook.spectral.dft;
010
011/**
012 * <p>
013 * Interface to be implemented by all one-dimensional DFT/FFT implementations.
014 * See Ch. 18 of [1] for additional details.
015 * </p>
016 * <p>
017 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
018 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
019 * </p>
020 * @see Dft1dDirect
021 * @see Dft1dFast
022 */
023public interface Dft1d {
024        
025        public int getSize();
026        public ScalingMode getScalingMode();
027        
028        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
029        
030        /**
031         * Sub-interface for DFT implementations on {@code float} data.
032         */
033        public interface Float extends Dft1d {
034                
035                /**
036                 * Performs an "in-place" DFT forward transformation on the supplied 1D {@code float} data.
037                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
038                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
039                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
040                 */
041                public void forward(float[] gRe, float[] gIm);
042                
043                /**
044                 * Performs an "in-place" DFT inverse transformation on the supplied 1D {@code float} spectrum.
045                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
046                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
047                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
048                 */
049                public void inverse(float[] GRe, float[] GIm);
050                
051                /**
052                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
053                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
054                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
055                 * 
056                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
057                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
058                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
059                 */
060                public void transform(float[] inRe, float[] inIm, boolean forward);
061                
062                default void checkSize(float[] re, float[] im) {
063                        if (re.length != this.getSize())
064                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
065                                        String.format("re: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", re.length, this.getSize()));
066                        
067                        if (im.length != this.getSize())
068                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
069                                        String.format("im: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", im.length, this.getSize()));
070                }
071                
072        }
073        
074        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
075        
076        /**
077         * Sub-interface for DFT implementations on {@code double} data.
078         */
079        public interface Double extends Dft1d {
080                
081                /**
082                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT forward transformation on the supplied {@code double} data.
083                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
084                 * 
085                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
086                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
087                 */
088                public void forward(double[] gRe, double[] gIm);
089                
090                /**
091                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied {@code double} spectrum.
092                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
093                 * 
094                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
095                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
096                 */
097                public void inverse(double[] GRe, double[] GIm);
098                
099                /**
100                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
101                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
102                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
103                 * 
104                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
105                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
106                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
107                 */
108                public void transform(double[] inRe, double[] inIm, boolean forward);
109                
110                default void checkSize(double[] re, double[] im) {
111                        if (re.length != this.getSize())
112                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
113                                        String.format("re: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", re.length, this.getSize()));
114                        
115                        if (im.length != this.getSize())
116                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
117                                        String.format("im: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", im.length, this.getSize()));
118                }
119                
120        }
121        
122}
